ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Good class to practice oral English and presentation
I improved my presentation skills. I also had the opportunity to discuss topics other than research related ones.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Good class to practice oral English and presentation. Teacher can give very useful feedbacks
Strengths: Everyone engages in the class. We have adequate chance to improve ourselves.

The presentations we had to prepare were really helpful. Videorecording them was also helpful for us to get feedback and improve. Reading a book and discussing on it was also a positive experience. As a weakness, I would mention that fours hours per week is quite a lot of time for a Ph.D. student, that has also other assignments and responsibilities. In my opinion, it should be less.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: recommend. Good class to practice oral English and presentation. It's important to international students.
I would recommend it to students not feeling comfortable enough about their oral communication skills.
